thinking.disposable_income: The Astrodome Area has relatively high median household income around $65,000, with many professionals working in the Texas Medical Center and surrounding institutions.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Residents have moderate to high discretionary spending capacity, with significant retail and entertainment options in the area including NRG Stadium and various shopping centers.
thinking.accessibility: The area has good transit connectivity with Red Line light rail and multiple bus routes, high car ownership rates, and proximity to major highways like 610 Loop and SH 288.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1) Prioritized balanced policies that maintain reasonable transit fares while implementing moderate driving fees to reduce congestion around medical center and stadium events. 2) Moderate tax rate of 1% helps fund transit improvements without overly burdening residents' discretionary spending. 3) Selected proposals that reduce transit travel times to under 55 minutes while keeping driving times competitive. 4) Considered that many residents can afford slightly higher costs but value time savings. 5) Aimed to improve transit service for medical center workers while maintaining driving as viable option.
